page.title: 16CLYRO COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: In 1974 throughout Wales, Community Councils replaced the old Parish Councils. They form the first tier of Local Government. Members are elected to serve the local community. Elections take place every four years. Meetings are held monthly in the local Primary School.{Clyro Community {Council}consists of nine members and a part time clerk. New Officers are elected at the Annual General Meeting in May and the Annual Parish Meeting takes place in April. Clyro Community Council is a member of both{Radnor}and{The Powys {Association of Local Councils,}who in turn are members of the National AssociationTwo members of the Council serve as{Governors}of the Local Primary School and on two occasions the{Chairman}has been invited to a{Royal Garden Party.
